website_summaries.verdict: Versatile stand-alone operation and good photo quality make the Canon Pixma iP6600D appealing for digital camera owners, but slow operation and mediocre text output mean it's a bad choice for SOHO or business use.
pros: 3.5-inch LCD and full set of controls on the printer
direct printing via PictBridge, IrDA, and (with adapter) Bluetooth

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer, and I'm glad I picked it from the competition. If you use the included software, the photos print just like they look on your computer screen and are excellent quality in terms of color and resolution. (If you print from photoshop or some other program, you may have to spend time adjusting the colors of your files to get them to print correctly.) Also, the ink cartridges are ~$14 each and you need refills rather frequently. I've also had a hard time finding these refills-- it seems that these ink cartridges aren't as popular as those for other canon models and are often sold out or hidden at the very bottom of the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: A. Good Customer

customer_reviews.title: I especially like this model because it has a black toner plus ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this printer. Last one was 10 years old. I especially like this model because it has a black toner plus 5 different color toners. I think it prints better colors than when you have a multi-color toner cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Witzy

customer_reviews.title: Now just another door stop - crap I need more doors! Due to high costs of INK
customer_reviews.text: I liked it until it ran out if ink - the kids caused a paper jam, didn't tell anyone and it drained every cartridge :-( I really think that printer companies are really INK SUPPLY companies. It costs more to replace all of the INK CARTRIDGES than it does to replace the printer. It did print pictures and text OK Now just another door stop - crap I need more doors!
customer_reviews.author: TwoBuck40

customer_reviews.title: Try it and you'll love your pictures.
customer_reviews.text: The only printer I will use. The photos are incredible. Sometimes the ink cartridges can get a little messy but the quality of the photos are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Malkinski  Joyce Malkinski

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and value
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'm just a typical home photographer but I think the printer is spectacular. People can't believe that my glossy photos were printed from home. Easy to set up, easy to use, and wireless printing (using an adapter you must buy separately) to permit printing from a laptop works fine. I have no idea why people are complaining about the text qualities of this printer. I use it primarily for text and I think it looks just great. A terrific home/office printer and an exceptional value.
customer_reviews.author: Runsilent

customer_reviews.title: Terrific photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I have used Epson printers for several years, partly due to the ability to use third-party inks. This Canon 6600D, although last year's hardware, is still a terrific printer and a terrific buy. The ink is about one-third of Epson ink, so I do not have to use third-party inks. It produces wonderful photos on photo paper, although the quality on plain paper is less striking. Prints relatively fast, the thing reads all cards other than xD, and the screen is very userful.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Yes yes yes!
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness you had this! I’m too old to try a new billing software. I needed a new one to keep my office up and running for a few more years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer - so far
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer a few weeks ago. I chose it over a similar HP model because of the duplex printing feature. It automatically flips the paper around and prints both sides of the page and also keeps multiple copies collated...very neat! I am very pleased with the photos it prints. I like the 6 seperate color cartridges but don't have enough experience with them yet to evaluate cost savings in the long run. My usual printer preference is with HP as I am still using one that must be about 10 years old and is pretty much trouble free. I hope the Canon gives me equally good service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest printer, but it is a good solid home printer. With the seperate carraterage for bordersless 4/6 precut. This printer also does a nice job on grayscale printing. Again there are better printers on the market, but for general home usage as well as printing out photes for around the house this printers is a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA iP6600D
customer_reviews.text: The print quality of the Pixma is fine--I have no complaints. But the reason I downrated this model is because the manufacturer has gone to extreme lengths to prevent the user from using any inks other than their own. My previous Canon, i960, allowed the use of generic inks. We all know WHY the companies do this. Frankly, it would be more honest to ask more for the machine & let us use whatever ink we prefer. But, hey, this is America, & it'll never happen.
customer_reviews.author: JBGrun

customer_reviews.title: THE ALL TIME GREAT PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all! I purchased one of these years ago and wore it out - the tried to find a replacement and was thrilled to find this one here at a fait price and in factory new condition - in all honesty I do love it. It does what I want it to do with very little fuss - a rare thing in today's world!
customer_reviews.author: John D. Linhardt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but....................
customer_reviews.text: This printer does a nice job and prints out very good photos, but, if you alter or enhance your photos with photoshop and then try to save them to disk and print then it will not work. You must only be able to do your editing in the printer, not a convenient way to do editing. Overall I would give it a 3 out of 5 due to lack of editing ability.
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great value with great features
customer_reviews.text: Duplex printing, big preview screen, multiple photo input sources, good speed, very good photo print quality, fairly quiet, separate ink tanks... The list goes on. My only suggestion is a built-in Ethernet network port
customer_reviews.author: Dale Borja

customer_reviews.title: Terrific printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big review writer but I had to leave a comment on this printer. We just got it and I love it. The pictures are beautiful. Someone had mentioned a red cast to the pictures. I had this too and it was easily fixed. I followed some instructions on Canon's website (can't remember exactly what they were but they were not difficult). I definitely recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gail Luther

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST PRINTERS YOU CAN GET, DIFFERENT INK COLORS,PRINTS ARE VERY NICE
customer_reviews.author: Sage B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: GOOD LOOKING PRINTS BUT HARD TO FIGURE OUT HOW TO SIZE IT AND PUT IN THE PAPER CORRECTLY
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Fast with Very Good Print Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this printer a few days, but so far so good. It is really fast and the print quality is very good. The only reason that I say it isn't excellent is that with the default settings and Canon Photo Pro paper, shots taken indoors without flash have a slightly more orangish tone than on my calibrated monitor.
customer_reviews.author: MFD14534

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint that I have is the cost of the ink. I have printed several pictures and the quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Awsome!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is VERY easy to use. The quality of the prints it produces are indistinguishable from those you'd receive from a first rate print shop. My technological challenged wife loves it and is even able to replace the print cartridges! Changing paper sizes and types is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great printer but ink goes a little quick
customer_reviews.text: I like the great photo quality but the downside is that the ink runs out a little quick. If you change setting to use less ink you lose a little quality in the picture. Overall I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Medina

customer_reviews.title: great home printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, works like a charm. This printer is being used by a teenager and no complaints from either parent or child. The ink system is also great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Seven years later and this printer continues to amaze me. Cartridges are available from various resellers,. I have never had a problem with them.
customer_reviews.author: MakaDudi

customer_reviews.title: Super Printer
customer_reviews.text: It is the best printer we have had so we wanted a spare as they do not make a printer with these features any more.
customer_reviews.author: Donald H. Duff

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful so far
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for only a few weeks but so far it is great. And the purchase from AMAZON was speedy and flawless.
customer_reviews.author: R.G. Rainwater

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA iP6600D Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great photo printer, other features I like are the borderless printer options, especially for 8x10 photo's. Bill Mc Greendale Wi
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mack

customer_reviews.title: Great Photo printer
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I am an event photographer and this printer creates prints that rival photo labs.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: canon printer
customer_reviews.text: when i was shopping for the printer i put the old printer with the compatable inks i still have the printed was on the list. but the inks were not compatable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lorenc

customer_reviews.title: wheres the ink?
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer from Amazon about a week ago now, we are very impressed with the photo prints and features but it seems that Canon is not willing to lose the big money by allowing cartridges out on the market. I'm afraid that we will run out of ink before we can find a reasonably priced source for canon ink!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer and the photo prints are perfect. Very easy to use this printer. I really like being able to have photo paper and standard paper loaded at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Larry F. Lauber

customer_reviews.title: canon pixma ip6600d photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I've just started using this printer. So far I can say it is an excellent printer. I'm pleased with the product, and with the service received from amazon.com. Sam Green.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel A. Green

customer_reviews.title: when I needed help from Canon tech support I was amazed that my new printer was discontinued in 2005 it ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new printer. when I needed help from Canon tech support I was amazed that my new printer was discontinued in 2005 it is now 2016. It will not read new format SD card or anything over 2GB cards. This is what scares me from buying large ticket items on the internet. Even if I return it it will still cost me return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the quick delivery! It was just as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L Snedeker

customer_reviews.title: In other words this printer is as bad as my old one
customer_reviews.text: This printer didn't deliver as expected. It wouldn't read my sd card and the printing wasn't a hundred percent. In other words this printer is as bad as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: MARCIA WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Still working after 20 months
customer_reviews.text: This is a 'late' review but I was interested in seeing if there was a 'better' Canon printer out there since I bought this one in March of 2006. There doesn't seem to be. I normally print from Photoshop and have calibrated both screen and printer to produced unsurpassed color. If you can still find one, this is the printer to buy. Mine originally cost $199 or $299 but Canon has a 'list' price of $99.99 - if you can get one that cheap, it's a steal!
customer_reviews.author: C B D

customer_reviews.title: Nice Print Quality But Awful Construction
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 years now. Print quality is excellent. Chassis of printer is flimsy. Paper sheet feeder not designed well as it allows the paper to shift sideways when being pulled in which makes the printing on the page crooked at times. Also, got an Error 5100 which could not be cleared even though I did everything recommended by the service manual to fix the problem. Printer is now dead. Check out a cheap color laser instead.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer 4 years ago. It's still going strong. Great quality photo prints. Great features like double-sided printing (Duplex) and direct LCD viewing/printing images from memory card. The silent mode for printing is really quite quiet. Note: It does require a lot of ink. Always try to keep spare ink on hand. I really have no need to replace this printer at this time. It fits so many of my needs to date still.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Superior Photo Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I dearly love my canon pixma ip6600D printer for my scrapbooking hobby. The photos are of photo lab quality. It allows me to print up to an 8 1/2 by 11 picture of great quality. I also have a canon compact photo printer CP220. It limited my pictures sizes to only a 4x6 while the quality was okay. Since I have had my pixma, I haven't even used the CP220. I would recommend this printer to anyone wanting photo lab quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: For the money,  you can't go wrong...
customer_reviews.text: I own this printer and have had it for almost two years with no problems. Others that I have given prints to are very impressed with the quality so it's not just me that thinks so. As far as finding ink cartridges, no, they're not in every store, but I haven't had any difficulty finding them either. When I bought it I paid more than the current price and I'm still not sorry I did. All in all, it performs admirably for a printer in this price range...
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Eight years and still going!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer 8 years ago and all I have to say is that this printer has never givin me any trouble. I was thinking of buying the All in one printer but I just cant let this one go. It works great and prints excellent photos. I have no complaints thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have own this printer for almost 6 years, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have own this printer for almost 6 years, all I can see is that it has never failed me. I have never had to troubleshoot it and I use it on a daily basis. I am thinking of getting another one for work.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmin

customer_reviews.title: CARTRIDGES DO NOT LAST LONG AND ARE TOO EXPENSIVE
customer_reviews.text: Considering the number of individual color cartridges in this printer, I expected a much higher quality print. The colors do not seem any better than my old HP printer, and that printer only had a tri color and black cartridge. It also cost much less. The cartridges do not last long and are quite expensive. Recently, I experienced two clogs in the print heads. Long story short, I'd gladly sell this printer, but do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: J PRO00

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!! WOWW!!!! WOWWW!!!!!!!!!8-}
customer_reviews.text: This photo printer get's more then 5*stars, I GIVE IT***********************************.I have a digital camera(6.1) & was trying to print photo's out of an all-in one printer(so they say it prints good photo's LOL) and the photo's just were not right(color was off,lines though the photo's ect...). I don't know if any of you have had this problem. But any how back to this KICK BUTT photo printer, the photo's come out looking like what you would get if you develop them at the store. GREAT for Scrapbooking, & doing fun things with you photo's.With PC or with out PC(to just print photo's) VERY EASY TO USE, very easy(my 11yr son use it). WELL WORTH THE $$$$$$$$$$$$$
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Brogan

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA iP6600D Blasts Away the Competition
customer_reviews.text: The PIXMA iP6600D photo printer is the quintessential printer. Your photos will impress and everybody will want to know what photo printer you have. This PIXMA model makes you a creative artist. I wouldn't want another brand other than a Canon. I own this printer and I was convinced upon receiving my first developed photo that Canon need not worry about the competition. If you want a photo printer that is going to make you #1 with photo enthusiasts, the PIXMA iP6600D is the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photo printer!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the photo prints from the PIXMA iP6600D. Good saturation without being cartoony. Smooth prints with the Canon Photo Pro paper. Great options whether printing from a camera or from the desktop. Quick, too - I have a G4 Quicksilver Mac with only USB 1.0, but 4x6 borderless prints take less than 30 seconds to come out. I have had trouble getting good prints from Photoshop but that probably can be fixed by fiddling with the color profiles. Better documentation on how to fix colors from different applications would have been appreciated. Still, a great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kellee Fong

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a techie - and don't ususally write reviews - just glean from others. -- But I have to tell you - this Pixma 6600 is THE BEST!! - I've had it about a month. I took it out of the box - plugged it in and photographs are perfect - self-made business cards look professional. I needed a greeting card and this wonderful machine did BOTH sides automatically, quick as a wink! -- 'Can't speak to ink useage as I've not run out yet - but the cartridges will be worth it for this quality of output.
customer_reviews.author: R. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Check for ink
customer_reviews.text: Once you decide on the quality of printer you like, one of the first things to do is check on the ink cartridges. Replacement cartridges can run into big bucks, especially if the printer only takes 2 tanks and you have to replace the entire color one even if only one of the colors run out. This printer uses multiple tanks, which is good, BUT I could find no generic/compatible cartridges available for it yet. Try looking on the web for the CLI-8 cartridges and see how much they cost. The other Canon Pixma's like the 6000 have compatible cartridges that are available very cheap, so watch your wallet when considering this product.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Haze

customer_reviews.title: Cannon 6600 Photo Printer Review
customer_reviews.text: I like this photo printer. It is compact and relativley lightweight; and, best of all, it produces excellent prints. It is relativley easy to operate for a dunce like me. I like doing my own prints versus sending them out to Costco or some other source becasue, I can do the editing at the photo printer and can do it over and over agin until I get it just right. If there are short-comings of this device it is the 40-45 seconds it takes to produce a picture. The upside to this issue is that the printer produces excellent prints.
customer_reviews.author: Josef K. Verner

customer_reviews.title: canon ip6600d
customer_reviews.text: this printer is a steal for around $150 u.s. ive printed tons of berderless prints and have not had to clean it yet. all my prints have been clean. separate ink color cartridges are great too. doesnt waste any ink. in fact ive spent more on ink and paper than i did on the printer. about 3 times more. its a pretty solid machiene and very easy to use. you dont even need a computer. in fact its easier to use it without one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sowell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer does not always work. The printer will either not recognize an ink cartridge, or indicates that there is more than one of the same cartridge even though there is not. The cartridges do no last long and are expensive. If, and that is a big if, you can the printer to work it prints fine. I would strongly suggest you purchase another printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T GET ANY BETTER THEN THIS!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it...The print quality is amazing looking. Im very pleased with the print plus color quality of pictures. If you're buying a printer for the first time i would highly recommend a canon but also this one because you will love it! I have alse compared prints from ordering online from a store to my new Canon PIXMA iP6600D and of course the pictures i have printed at home are even much more better looking,
customer_reviews.author: S. Kittredge

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the Box; Canon Help Center useless
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this "new" printer, only to notice that someone already wrote down the serial number in the manual. I smell re-furb. This printer leaves verticle voids in the printing, which is repeatable and NOT due to clogged heads. There is something really wrong with this one. Canon Help Center happily offered to send me a refurbished printer, in place of my "new" one, or suggested that I personally take is to a service center. How absurd to suggest either choice at my expense? I am returning this printer direct to Amazon, asking for a replacement. I can only hope that I get a truely new one.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: pixma ip6600d
customer_reviews.text: The printer was very easy for me to set up and install, if I can do it anyone can. The quality of the print is excellent even on plain paper. I have not explored all of its possibilities but will be doing so hoping all continues to be as easy and satisfactory as it has been so far.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. G.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and nice printer
customer_reviews.text: I use this in production and probably put 8000 sheets of various wait paper through it in a year for greeting cards and it never stops. Would be nice to have auto duplex, but that is why I have two set up, one doing each side to keep production rolling. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harmann

customer_reviews.title: great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I opened up the box and in ten minutes I was printing. I love the clarity of the pictures but it makes a difference what kind of paper you use. The Canon paper works great. I have not used the computer to make any changes to the images but the pictures I did print were amazing. I highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brown

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I would HIGHLY recommend buying another printer than this piece of s*. It worked fine for the first few weeks, then it suddenly kept coming up with an error message that cannot be bypassed. The Canon tech support was not helpful in the least, and I ended up having to buy a whole new set of ink cartridges. Very disappointed with this product and Canon in general.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Curry

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Canon printer and they keep getting better. The PIXMA i6600D is fast and quiet. The text quality is very good and the photo printing is the best of any brand printer I tested. This machine only confirms my loyalty Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Peale N Rode

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: Color pictures are excellent and very simple to set up. Since I use seperate software to edit pictures I can not comment on the printers editing features. I have a Canon scanner and digital camera. So far Canon products have not dissapointed me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lillie

customer_reviews.title: Way too expensive per print
customer_reviews.text: Please do yourself and your wallet a favor-buy another printer besides the Canon i6600D. The inks are very expensive and the amount of ink in each cartridge is so small you will be replacing them every other week. Canon wont let the consumer purchase alternative ink cartridges so they charge huge prices for each one. I wish I had read this review before I bought my printer.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Y. Speirs

customer_reviews.title: Great printer but ink is crazy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality pictures and prints. Lots of options with software too. But the ink?...Expensive and very hard to find. Be sure to have at least 3 black and 2 sets of colors when you have this printer. It will use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Holt

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Quality is #1. I was concerned when I read the other comments about the speed of printer. But the speed is great. Product is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Radliff

customer_reviews.title: Great printer...does more stuff than youc an imagine
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great. Better than most of the Epsons I tried. It's built very well, too. Also there is a way to enable DVD printing...use your imagination (ie google :) )
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very easy to use, just plug and play! Prints great quality photos!
customer_reviews.author: Printing Mom

customer_reviews.title: Printer Plus
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the price. Printer is compact, attractive,and performs well with high quality results.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: warning: this canon is a lemon
customer_reviews.text: We just received our Canon Pixma 1p6000d photo printer and we were really excited to set it up. Well, after putting in the printer cartridges we started to run the printer and we received a mysterious ERROR 5110 message. When we consulted the guide we were told to contact customer support, so basically there's nothing we can do but wait until tomorrow morning to get help. After spending almost $200 on this printer, we're very disappointed that we are having problems with it and we haven't even used it yet! We're probably going to return it and get an HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: ghost dog

customer_reviews.title: CANON 6600D PHOTO PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I have tested and/ or used three (3) different such printers and found that this was the best one by far.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley C. Lindberg

customer_reviews.title: all green
customer_reviews.text: my pictures are awful... all green hued... maybe I am supposed to make adjustments - I haven't read the manual... but out of the box the pictures are hideous...
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: A Little Known Fact!!
customer_reviews.text: Be warned that if you buy one, the set up instructions at one point direct you to "attach the USB cable." Guess what??? The #*#*# thing does not include a USB cable. Even the really inexpensive HP digital camera cames with a download cable... Big screw-up on Canon's part.. Order a cable with it unless you want to make a separate trip to town to buy a cable.. The one star rating is due entirely to not being able to hook the *$*$*$* thing up when I have the time...
customer_reviews.author: Coach Grandpa

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA iP6600D Photo Printer
product_meta.description:
Premium Performance with 3.5" Color LCD Viewer for Easy Photo Direct Printing

AMAZON.COM
The PIXMA iP6600D Photo Printer is a photo-printing powerhouse, with incredible quality and high end convenience. It delivers an amazing resolution of up to 9,600 x 2,400 dpi, for detail and clarity that will surpass your expectations. To achieve this, Canon Full-photolitho-graphy Inkjet Nozzle Engineering (FINE) uses a next-generation 3,072-nozzle print head that ejects precise, consistent droplets as small as one picoliter. Plus, we've added high intensity photo cyan and photo magenta to the conventional four inks, to increase the accuracy of color values. 

 The high performance doesn't stop there. The PIXMA iP6600D Photo Printer can produce a beautiful photo lab quality 4" x 6" borderless print in approximately 46 seconds. Plus, its advanced paper handling provides you with several smart printing options. The dual paper path allows you to keep two different paper types always loaded and ready to print. You can even create two-sided photos or special photo albums with select Canon media. 

 With the extra-large 3.5" LCD color viewer and control panel, you can evaluate and enhance the images on your compatible memory card before printing! For viewing, just insert the card into one of the built-in card slots and select the images. As needed, the PIXMA iP6600D Photo Printer will automatically correct for red eye, improve sharpness and enhance the light values on your subjects' faces. Or, you can fine tune the image yourself using the easy control panel. Then, print directly from the memory card! You can also print directly from a PictBridge compatible digital camera or DV camcorder. 

 The Canon ChromaLife100 system combines the PIXMA iP6600D Photo Printer's FINE print head technology and newly developed inks with select Canon photo papers, with results rivaling that of many conventional photos. And with the new smart LED ink tanks, your LED lamp flashes when ink is running low, and flashes even faster when nearing empty. 

 What's in the Box:
PIXMA iP6600D Photo Printer, iP6600D print head, power cord, FINE cartridges: CL-51, documentation kit, easy setup instructions, Canon Photo Paper Plus Glossy for Borderless Printing 4" x 6" sample pack
feature_bullets: Resolutions up to 9,600 x 2,400 dpi for both color and black printing
Print borderless 4" x 6" photos in just 46 seoncds; 8.5" x 11" in as little as 1.8 minutes
Print directly from PictBridge-compatible memory cards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars108 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
